description: Manage a server's Microsoft support operations auditing policy.

commands.name: az sql server ms-support audit-policy show
commands.summary: Show server Microsoft support operations audit policy.
commands.syntax:
az sql server ms-support audit-policy show [--ids]
                                           [--name]
                                           [--resource-group]
                                           [--subscription]

commands.name: az sql server ms-support audit-policy update
commands.summary: Update a server's Microsoft support operations auditing policy.
commands.syntax:
az sql server ms-support audit-policy update [--add]
                                             [--blob-storage-target-state {Disabled, Enabled}]
                                             [--eh]
                                             [--ehari]
                                             [--ehts {Disabled, Enabled}]
                                             [--force-string]
                                             [--ids]
                                             [--lats {Disabled, Enabled}]
                                             [--lawri]
                                             [--name]
                                             [--no-wait]
                                             [--remove]
                                             [--resource-group]
                                             [--set]
                                             [--state {Disabled, Enabled}]
                                             [--storage-account]
                                             [--storage-endpoint]
                                             [--storage-key]
                                             [--subscription]
examples:
az sql server ms-support audit-policy update -g mygroup -n myserver --state Enabled \
    --bsts Enabled --storage-account mystorage

az sql server ms-support audit-policy update -g mygroup -n myserver --state Enabled \
    --bsts Enabled --storage-endpoint https://mystorage.blob.core.windows.net \
    --storage-key MYKEY==
az sql server ms-support audit-policy update -g mygroup -n myserver --state Disabled
az sql server ms-support audit-policy update -g mygroup -n myserver --bsts Disabled

az sql server ms-support audit-policy update -g mygroup -n myserver --state Enabled \
    --lats Enabled --lawri myworkspaceresourceid

az sql server ms-support audit-policy update -g mygroup -n myserver
    --lats Disabled

az sql server ms-support audit-policy update -g mygroup -n myserver --state Enabled \
    --event-hub-target-state Enabled \
    --event-hub-authorization-rule-id eventhubauthorizationruleid \
    --event-hub eventhubname

az sql server ms-support audit-policy update -g mygroup -n myserver --state Enabled \
    --event-hub-target-state Enabled \
    --event-hub-authorization-rule-id eventhubauthorizationruleid

az sql server ms-support audit-policy update -g mygroup -n myserver
    --event-hub-target-state Disabled

commands.name: az sql server ms-support audit-policy wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition of the server's Microsoft support operations audit policy is met.
commands.syntax:
az sql server ms-support audit-policy wait [--created]
                                           [--custom]
                                           [--deleted]
                                           [--exists]
                                           [--ids]
                                           [--interval]
                                           [--name]
                                           [--resource-group]
                                           [--subscription]
                                           [--timeout]
                                           [--updated]
examples: az sql server ms-support audit-policy wait -g mygroup -n myserver --exists
